scenario: High-Level Design (HLD) for a new feature
steps: Run the command: aider --model google/gemini-2.0-flash-thinking-exp:free --task brainstorming --generate-hld
Provide a description of the feature and ask the model to generate a high-level architecture diagram.

scenario: Low-Level Design (LLD) for a specific module
steps: Run the command: aider --model google/gemini-2.0-flash-exp:free --task planning --generate-lld
Describe the module's functionality and request detailed class diagrams and flowcharts.
Run the command: aider --model meta-llama/llama-3.2-3b-instruct:free --task implementation --optimize-code
Provide the initial code snippet and ask the model to optimize it for performance and readability.
Run the command: aider --model microsoft/phi-3-medium-128k-instruct:free --task documentation --auto-comment
Provide the codebase and request inline comments and a summary of the code's functionality.
Run the command: aider --model google/gemma-2-9b-it:free --task review --refactor-code
Submit the code for review and ask the model to suggest improvements and refactor for better maintainability.
Run the command: aider --model google/learnlm-1.5-pro-experimental:free --task learning --analyze-code-patterns
Provide a codebase and ask the model to identify common patterns and suggest best practices.
Run the command: aider --model meta-llama/llama-3.2-90b-vision-instruct:free --task visualization --generate-diagrams
Describe a complex system architecture and request a visual representation or diagram.
Run the command: aider --model qwen/qwen-2-7b-instruct:free --task code-generation --implement-algorithms
Describe a complex algorithm or data structure and ask the model to implement it efficiently.
Run the command: aider --model mistralai/mistral-7b-instruct:free --task debugging --analyze-errors
Provide code with errors or unexpected behavior and ask the model to identify and explain the issues.
Run the command: aider --model openchat/openchat-7b:free --task collaboration --discuss-code
Start a discussion about a coding problem or architecture decision, simulating a pair programming session.
